# Introduction

As Budding GIS Analyst of an international urban and regional planning consulting company. This study aims to build up a GIS for the proposed new capital area. The study utilises GIS-Enabled Urban Planning Support System by integrating open government data and other open source data sets.The study further collect, process and analyse spatially related issues using relevant real world data.

## Objectives

1. Prepare a report of survey to be submitted to the National Development Planning Agency (abbreviated Bappenas) on the analysis of the proposed Study Area

2. Use GIS analysis and multi-criteria evaluation method to identify site suitability for the proposed new capital city according to the proposed Research Criteria.

# Results

Usually you want to have a nice table displaying some important results that you have calculated. In `posterdown` this is as easy as using the `kable` table formatting you are probably use to as per typical R Markdown formatting.

```{r mytable, out.width='80%'}

```

Or with figures: Figure \@ref(fig:standard-plot), or Figure \@ref(fig:morefigs).

```{r standard-plot, out.width='80%', fig.align='center', fig.cap='Great figure!', fig.height=5}
plot(mtcars[1:2])
```

```{r morefigs, out.width='80%', echo=TRUE, fig.cap='Amazing, right?!', fig.height=5}
data <- iris

plot(x = data$Sepal.Length, 
     y = data$Sepal.Width, 
     col = data$Species,
     pch = 19, 
     xlab = "Sepal Length (cm)",
     ylab = "Sepal Width (cm)")

```
